revision.text:
{{Wireless embedded system |brand=BreezeCOM |model=AP-DS.11 |revision= |asin= |fcc_date=11/05/1999 |manuf_country=Netherlands |manuf=No Wires Needed |manuf_model=Parrot 1100 |manuf_rev= |availability=uncommon |type=access point |fcc_id=OGD10310308 |ic_id=780 102 1699A |pwr_v=9 |pwr_amp=1.67 |pwr_conn=barrel |cpu1_brand=VLSI |cpu1_model=VPS10101-1 |cpu1_cspeed= |fla1=512 KiB |fla1_brand=AMD |fla1_model=AM29F040B-120PC |ram1=2 |ram1_brand=Alliance |ram1_model=AS7C4096-15JC |ram1_num=4 |expansion_if_types= |expansion_usb_num= |jtag= |serial= |wi1_chip1_brand=VLSI |wi1_chip1_model=VPS10101-1 |wi1_chip2_brand=Harris |wi1_chip2_model=HFA3860 |wi1_chip3_brand=Harris |wi1_chip3_model=HFA3624 |wi1_802dot11_protocols=b |wi1_ant_conn=SMA |eth_none= |eth_cpu= |eth_chip1_brand=AMD |eth_chip1_model=AM79C961A |sw_cpu= |sw_brand= |sw_model= |lan_speed=10M |lan_ports=1 |wan_ports= |flags=parts list |tp_firmware= |802dot11_protocols=b |default_ssid= |default_ssid_regex= |default_ip= |default_user= |default_pass= |oui=00:50:8B |oui_eth=00:50:8B }} [https://web.archive.org/web/20001212062400/http://www.breezecom.com:80/Products/DS11AccessPoint.html Product page (via archive.org)], [https://web.archive.org/web/20000901022354/http://www.breezecom.com:80/pdfs/DS11_Brochure899.pdf Datasheet (via archive.org)] :The datasheet notes the antenna connector type as 'Proprietary SMA'. The threading may be non-standard, somewhat like the [[Intel PRO/Wireless 5000 LAN PCI Adapter]].
"Parrot 11Mbps" and "MAC V3.2" is silkscreened on the board. :This access point is a '''No Wires Needed''' Parrot 1100, like the [[Compaq WL400]].
This device is using a '''VLSI''' VPS10101-1 ('''Ruby II''' General-Purpose PCMCIA controller w/ 32-bit ARM6 core [http://www.thefreelibrary.com/VLSI+introduces+Ruby+II+PCMCIA+controller.-a016410275 PR]) and an '''AMD''' Am79C961AKC ISA Ethernet controller. :The VLSI CPU is presumably handling the MAC + AP functions of this board.
Per the FCC parts list.. *the '''VLSI''' VPS10101-1 is marked as the CPU *an [http://www.xilinx.com/support/documentation/data_sheets/ds060.pdf '''Xilinx''' Spartan XCS10] (XCS10-3VQ100C) FPGA, not visible on the below board scan - presumably under the RF shield *an additional 128k x 8 SRAM ('''UMC''' UM611024BSW-15), which is not visible on the below board scan. *the RFIC collection is a motley collection '''Harris''''s '''PRISM''' (the original) ICs **'''HFA3860''' (IV) - BBP (BaseBand Processor) **'''HFA3724''' (IN) - QAM (Modulator/Demodulator) **'''HFA3624''' (IA) - RFIC (Prescalar + IF/RF) **'''HFA3524''' (IA) - DS (Digital Synthesizer) **'''HFA3424''' (IB) - LNA (Low Noise Amp) **'''HFA3925''' (IA96) - PA (Power Amp)
{{WiFiCert|W000592|04/10/2000}}
The power adapter included with the device is a '''Sunpower''' MA15-090 (9V, 1.67A).
==Capab/Config== *The device supports 40-bit WEP encryption. *There is no HTTP interface on these devices. *Configuration is meant to be done through SNMP using '''NWN''''s configuration software.
==Images== <gallery caption="Compaq WL400 ([[NWN]] Parrot 1100) board"> File:Compaq WL400 board top.jpg|board top File:Compaq WL400 board bot.jpg|board bottom </gallery>[[Has images::internal| ]]
==External links== *[http://www.tomshardware.com/forum/10770-43-search-driver-nowiresneeded-accesspoint ''No Wires Needed Access point'' on '''TomsHardware''' forums]
